dimension: 4 3/4 x 1 7/8 x 3/4 in. (12.07 x 4.76 x 1.91 cm) (without tassels or tie)
title: Amulet
text: Many northern Plains women made beaded amulets that contained their child's umbilicus. It is said that this type of amulet maintains the sacred connection between mother and child. When the child is young, the amulet is often used as a toy. When the child becomes and adult, the mother keeps the item and occasionally wears it on her belt, indicating her accomplishment of raising a good child. When an amulet is traded or sold, the umbilicus is usually removed.
description: diamond shaped; beaded overall with color blocks in light blue, red, yellow and purple on one side, geometric motif in pink, blue, yellow, white, red and green on other side; hide tassels with green bead detail on points
